alert.note: Alert for Erie (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 18 at 8:27AM EST until February 18 at 2:17PM EST by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban area and small stream flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues. * WHERE...A portion of western New York, including the following county, Erie. * WHEN...Until 800 PM EST Friday. * IMPACTS...Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. Streams continue to rise and remain high due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 817 AM EST, local law enforcement reported high flows on area streams and creeks. Flooding is already occurring. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen in addition to snowmelt. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Buffalo, Cheektowaga, West Seneca, North Tonawanda, Clarence, Lackawanna, Kenmore, Depew, Amherst, Tonawanda, Lancaster, Hamburg, East Aurora, Williamsville, Grand Island, Evans, Elma, Boston, Eden and Marilla. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
